title: 5 Must To See Kerala Tourist Attractions
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > 5 Must To See Kerala Tourist Attractions 5 Must To See Kerala Tourist Attractions By admin on July 23, 2015 Pin It 
Kerala is a very beautiful state in India. There are many scenic Kerala tourist attractions, which you should see. The beauty of this place cannot be explained or written in simple words. You need to experience on your own. Coconut palms carpet the shores and the hills adding great beauty to the place. 
Kerala is considered the land of enchantments featuring green backwaters, golden sands and deep and dark forest reserves. The pristine beaches of Kerala are not the only things that attract visitors to this place but it is also its Ayurveda magic that refreshes every individual visiting this charismatic place. Popular Kerala Tourist Attractions 
Some of the most popular Kerala tourist attractions, which you should not miss during your visit include: Kumarakom 
Kumarakom is one of the most popular Kerala tourist attractions. It is located very close to the city called Kottayam and is famous for the houseboats in the backwaters of the Vembanad Lake. 
This lake is the largest freshwater lake in Kerala and even the longest in India. The Bird Sanctuary of Kumarakom is also famous and it serves as a home to migratory and local birds. Alleppey 
Alleppey is located at the edge of the Arabian coast in the Alappuzha district. This place offers visitors with beautiful beaches, lagoons and backwaters. 
Alleppey is also known for the famous boat race of Kerala known as Nehru Trophy Boat Race, which is conducted on second Saturday of August every year. Munnar 
Munnar is a very popular hill station located in Kerala. It is positioned at the convergence of three rivers called Kundaly, Nallathanni and Madhurapuzha. Munnar is located in Idukki district and it is popular as one of the most important tea plantation areas in Kerala. 
Apart from tea plantations, dense valleys, green mountains and forests make Munnar one of the most romantic honeymoon destinations in India. Chottanikkara Bhagavathy Temple 
Chottanikkara Bhagavathy Temple is one of the most popular temples of Kerala. The temple is located at the exterior borders of Kochi. 
Two important deities worshipped at the temple are Badrakali and Rajarajeswari. People are of the belief that both these Goddesses possess extreme power. Poovar Island 
Poovar Island is another tourist attraction in Kerala that should not be missed by tourists. This is a place where you will be able to get the best in the category of visionary pleasures. The island is a popular estuary in Kerala because it connects with sea, river and lake.
